intro: Trichomanes virgatulum, commonly known as the zigzag fern, is a small, epiphytic fern belonging to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, narrow leaves that are often arranged in a zigzag pattern, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, such as on tree trunks or rocks in tropical and subtropical regions. Its fronds are usually less than 10 centimeters in length and have a feathery appearance. Trichomanes virgatulum plays a role in forest ecosystems by contributing to the biodiversity of epiphytic plant communities.
